<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27" lineLink="/docs/api/groups/llvmcerror/#gaaba79ae56a17485c5d3fbd004ff60e47"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typedef</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> void (&#42;<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcerror/#gaaba79ae56a17485c5d3fbd004ff60e47">LLVMFatalErrorHandler</a>)(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Reason);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;&#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; Install a fatal error handler. By default, if LLVM detects a fatal error, it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; will call exit(1). This may not be appropriate in many contexts. For example,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; doing exit(1) will bypass many crash reporting/tracing system tools. This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; function allows you to install a callback that will be invoked prior to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; call to exit(1).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcerror/#gaf6159e6764fb23072ec25514b90b0ebd">LLVMInstallFatalErrorHandler</a>(<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcerror/#gaaba79ae56a17485c5d3fbd004ff60e47">LLVMFatalErrorHandler</a> Handler);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;&#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; Reset the fatal error handler. This resets LLVM&#39;s fatal error handling</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; behavior to the default.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcerror/#ga7ea3d621a4b178b39e068f2c017ae617">LLVMResetFatalErrorHandler</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;&#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; Enable LLVM&#39;s built-in stack trace code. This intercepts the OS&#39;s crash</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; signals and prints which component of LLVM you were in at the time if the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment"> &#42; crash.</Highlight></CodeLine>
